website_summaries.verdict: A versatile, intuitive combo with 17 amp models draped in legendary Fender tone.
pros: Go from clean to crunchy and everything in between with an array of easy-to-use and customizable amp models
This speaker boasts 20 watts of power for solo practice or jamming, and the amp’s software allows you to record, edit, store and share your music
Reverb, delay, tremolo, phaser, and other effects are included
cons: The amp modeling software requires a computer to utilize effectively, as the amp’s knobs don’t provide much dexterity

customer_reviews.title: Loaded for Mustang
customer_reviews.text: Loaded with features. Plenty loud, although I don't have to crank-it-up much to practice in any room within my house. The software can be a little tricky, technically speaking, but it does allow you to chose all sorts of pedal and cabinet options - pre-amp or post-amp as well and then save your choices into custom presets. Not as small as a lot of the personal-sized amps, but plenty small for a practice amp; relatively light weight too (for its size). Whether you want a classic sound or a overdriven death metal sound, you'll find this one to be fairly versatile. Of all the amps that I have barrowed or bought, this has quickly become my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hagen

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wish this amp was better than it is. First and most disappointing is that Fender has discontinued support for Fuse software but is still using it in their advertising and has no suggestion that a replacement is in the works. Next is that the factory presets don’t sound much like any effects you might hear on recordings. I have yet the work with customizing my own presets and w/o Fuse it may be a bit of a challenge. One tip, to play w/o effects, press the tap button while turning it on and the removes the presets which lets you use your effects pedals.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: New buyers be aware that the Fuse software discontinued 3/20/20
customer_reviews.text: Great amp - bought it and just found out that Fuse software will no longer available! "Effective March 20, 2020 Fender® FUSETM has been discontinued. Fender® FUSETM is no longer actively supported by Fender." Software does not come with amp and it is no longer available for download. No other explanation or if a new software might be available/applicable in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in VA

customer_reviews.title: Killer small amp!
customer_reviews.text: This is one versatile "little" amp! Presets, modeling, tone controls, foot peddles, effects, internet connectivity... It's got it all, and a great sound with serious tone. You don't have to be a pro to get started with this, just plug it in and play. If it doesn't have the sound you like, just keep turning the dial, you'll find one. We will be using this as a practice amp and for recording. Don't worry about the neighbors, this bugger rips at low volume with no loss of bite. Check it out on YouTube and you'll hear what I'm talking about!
customer_reviews.author: C. Druitt

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding amp even thou software is no longer supported.
customer_reviews.text: So the amp is awesome. I say this because it’s very affordable and you get so much for what you pay for. Yes it’s stupid fender no longer supports the software. However, for the price ,,,this thing is Amazing. If you have an old laptop laying around you can still use the fender software. Note, I also have a Mac running OS Catalina and I can’t use it with it. That does suck, But in all honesty it doesn’t take away from the amp itself. Once you program the guitar tones on an old computer it remains saved in the amp. You should be playing music with your amp and not messing with the knobs anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R.

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: This AMP is advertised to work with software \. Well the 3 software titles that you are supposed to get are no longer available to download and they can no longer produce serial numbers for the software either. I called and talked to Fender and they were no help at all. I told them I was going to return it and the exact words from the Fender rep were I Don't Blame You. So now that I have wasted my time buying this and waiting for it to be delivered now I have to start all over again
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hall

customer_reviews.title: Outdated
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice amp but didn't realize until I bought it that it is outdated. The ability to use Fuse is no longer available. Fender stopped updates with Windows 8. It does have some nice effects and sounds nice but limited. With Fuse you could use you computer to create new presets. You can adjust things with the amp but confusing at times. Sad Fender decided to not update software.
customer_reviews.author: Alton W

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Little Amp.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I was amazed at the sound quality and versatility this amplifier has, the modeling part is really fun to use, the option to switch between different types of amps and different levels of reverb/delay settings is fun. I like that even at very low volume it still holds onto the sounds, It's just fun to play around with and makes playing guitar interesting and unique. For $128 it was well worth the $$$. I haven't noticed any annoying humming, buzzing or feedback sounds much to my surprise.
customer_reviews.author: EJF

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little rock box
customer_reviews.text: For the price this thing is pretty impressive. Also very portable. I had a Roland Cube 40 Watt and this 20 Watter at the same time for a couple weeks, and ended up returning the Cube, even though a mail-in rebate on the Roland would have made the price pretty close. I just thought the pre-sets on the Fender were more varied and natural-sounding. Only real negative would be that not all the effects settings are labeled, so you'd have to refer to the guide to know what everything is called.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Not like back in the day !
customer_reviews.text: I have played guitar since the early 70's & was looking for some volume for my 1st guitar in 20 years & always trusted Fender. I remember that tube amps were always said to sound better. Not anymore, I was blown away with the power, quality & mostly the sheer amount of effects possible & with support for headphones,foot switch & mini USB for backing tracks or anything else pc related. Fender is apparently alive & well & now wanting an american strat to go with my Les Paul.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Very good amp for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this amp (first one I've had) for two guitars, my 6-string acoustic/electric and a new lap steel I'm learning to play. The controls are a wee bit difficult. For example, the A through H presets are still a mystery, but I'm working on it. The "instructions" could be complete and more clear. If you're listening Fender, not everyone who buys the Mustang I V2 already knows how to use it. I was very happy to see that the amp will take headphones, so I can use it without bothering my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Rufus Morph

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little amp!! I seriously don't know how you could do better for the price. The amp modeling is really fun to use. The sounds and delays are good enough to make your practice time much more fun. If you're buying this amp for a personal practice amp, then you've made the right choice. Online sound upgrades are cool too!! If your wanting to use this amp for band practice or live performance, it's not powerful enough for a big room or to compete with other instruments. But if you want a great little amp to jam with at home by yourself, this amp is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser13

customer_reviews.title: buzz, buzz, buzz
customer_reviews.text: I also have some kind of electrical buzzing issue with this that I am trying to figure out. Some kind of grounding thing. If I touch metal parts on the guitar, it quiets down. So I thought maybe it was the guitar, but when I plug guitar into my bass amp, it's dead silent, and sounds good too. So there's something with the electronics on this Fender I think.
customer_reviews.author: theskeptic

customer_reviews.title: Works short term.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted an upgrade from my Fender frontman, and I was very impressed at first. The sound quality is decent and the price is great, but after about eight months, it started to have noise problems. Now it cuts out every few minutes a year later. It works if you don't play much, but if you play all the time it will eventually stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Dan and Rachel

customer_reviews.title: ... computer assist the USB control of effects might be nice; however
customer_reviews.text: If your practice space is integrated with computer assist the USB control of effects might be nice; however, I replaced it with a Champion 40 for "turn a knob" control of effects and tone and a 12" speaker for a little more money. I would suggest a mustang III to get a 12" speaker and more power if you are going with the mustang's USB controlled (that is, computer as central tool in practice space) so you have something you can use to play with others after a few months of practice and callus building. The super low price may be attractive, just know you will be trading up in a short while if you continue playing..
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great product hampereed by lack of software support
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little modeling amp, with lots of amp models and effects, most of which sound pretty good. However, it needs software to realize its potential, and the FUSE software provided by Fender is no longer supported. For me, using FUSE with Windows 10 is an exercise in frustration. More often than not, it fails to start with a cryptic Silverlight error message. Fortunately, there is a third party Android app (Remuda) that replaces FUSE nicely. AFAIK, iphone users are just out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: FrankB

customer_reviews.title: Fender no longer supports the cool software that goes with this amp
customer_reviews.text: If you liked using Fender Fuse software with this amp, It is no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool low freq response as a Bass Amp
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this rig primarily as a Bass amplifier and after firing it up with my Bass plugged in and tweeking in one of the presets and the proper controls and a few experiments it did not take long for me to find and save the setting that suited my Needs, the biggest plus is I didn't need to buy an outboard Stomp box, the integrated DSP unit and presets is more than i expected, this rig surely delivers as advertised. The micro usb port opens doors to more experimentations with customn effects via your PC .
customer_reviews.author: samuel labrador

customer_reviews.title: You can play harmonica on this amp with the correct uploaded presets.
customer_reviews.text: This amp is setup for guitar out of the box. It sounds great with a guitar and so many options for different effects. But I actually purchased it for harmonica playing. At first I couldn't play the harmonica through it, just too much feedback, etc. But after some research I was able to upload different harmonica presets, load them into the amp via USB port, online fuse software and get it totally setup for harmonica. Wow, its awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little practice amp
customer_reviews.text: This has some incredible sounds and options for a 20 W amp, it's perfect for practicing and trying new sounds. Plenty of options and the price is absolutely worth it. Totally good tones, easy to adjust and the onboard tuner is a great feature. For this price point and Fender quality it works in every possible way. Hit it and let your neighbors know you play guitar!
customer_reviews.author: BOJO1507

customer_reviews.title: Excellent practice amp for the small room.
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed at the quality of this amp. The sounds from the equipment are truly top notch. Fender has made a product that faithfully reproduces classic fender amps and british amps. It's loud for such a small speaker and wattage. With the software, programing effects and cabs is easy. I play mostly ragtime and jazz and the clean channels are perfect for me. The price point is spot on for the quality. Haven't tried recording yet but plan on doing that soon.
customer_reviews.author: Steven McPeak

customer_reviews.title: I've never had so much fun.
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars all the way baby! In over 40 years of playing, I've never had so much fun. Forget all the expensive accessories, many of which I never could afford, this baby is a blast in a small package. I only wish we could have had something like this decades ago, maybe I would have actually become the rock-star we all dream about becoming. It makes me wonder though, are all the makers of foot pedals hating on Fender for making these so good yet cheap to own? Yes, all the pedals/affects I've always wanted to try and more. The new millennium rocks! Now, where is my anti-grav car with robotic cat-girl pilot I was promised in the 60's ?
customer_reviews.author: Brian001

customer_reviews.title: a fantastic little lamp
customer_reviews.text: I've had this amp about 2 weeks now. I have fully explored all of its settings and went online to fenderfuse and got even more settings. This is a great amp and it has a lot of different sounds It can make. I have a Stratocaster and it really produces those great fendertones. overdrive or Distortion they're in there as well. I was going to buy a $500 tube amp but for less than half the price I got it much more versatile amp. I would recommend this amp.
customer_reviews.author: SRQ Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Fender
customer_reviews.text: I am very excited to be an owner of such a veritile amp with so many sound options to choose from. The only thing I would like changed is the headphone jack with a 3.5mm. My good headphones have a 1/4in. connecter so I got creative so the headphone jack wouldn't stand up so high was an adapter with 2'in cord having the 3.5mm with the 1/4in hanging down to loosen the stress of the adapter. Otherwise I would give this amp a 5 rating
customer_reviews.author: 5Uks1Guit1ManShow

customer_reviews.title: Incredible features for a practice amp!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible sounding amp. I've never seen this much versatility in a small practice amp like this. Loud enough and sounds great for rehearsal and may even be great for recording! Great job on this one Fender! Unfortunately, the only Fender footswitch that works with this one is just an A/B between two channels.
customer_reviews.author: Anthem

customer_reviews.title: Good modeling practice amp
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't a big fan of the built in presets. Once I plugged it into my computer using FUSE I was able to create several models I really loved. I also use it as my recording interface. Again using the preamp models from FUSE I've created, I don't need to worry about buying amp sim plugins for my DAW. With the aux in and line out in addition, you can't ask for much more in a small amp
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Amp software is out there
customer_reviews.text: I bought this amp just for the presets and there ok for the most part but to make this amp shine you need the software that Fender has discontinued. The good thing is it is still out there you just have to look for it. Just do a search for fender-fuse-mustang-v2-archive should be still up. Hope this help with this great little amp I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: Converstion Man

customer_reviews.title: Great tones, just not for me
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed playing with the different tones you can get out of this amp, however I will opt to switch to the Blackstar ID:Core 20 V2 because it fits my particular style better. I couldn't find a high gain tone that I liked with the Mustang, but there are many great tones to be found in this amplifier!
customer_reviews.author: BenQuixote

customer_reviews.title: An amazing little amp with plenty of oomph
customer_reviews.text: An amazing little amp with plenty of oomph. A primarily acoustic guitarist, I recently decided to revisit my rock roots and play electric again. In the 1960's I paired a Fender Bassman with a Vox Phantom IV bass, and have been a loyal "Fenderanian" ever since. This time around, I paired this amp with an Epiphone Les Paul and I get to do pretty much whatever I want with it, in a wide variety of styles and sounds. My wife says it's too loud, which is, of course, exactly the kind of review you'd like. I HIGHLY recommend this little workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Case

customer_reviews.title: As a beginner, this amp is awful. That's ...
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner, this amp is awful. That's not a slam at the quality or the design. It just isn't accommodating for a new guitar player. There is a lot of settings at the pc level that you have to tweak that really makes it hard to just get started playing. For a veteran player that doesn't want to spend a ton of money on pedals, this amp is for you. I'm hoping I eventually grow into this amp.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy B.

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Amp suddenly has no audio. I spoke with Fender support and they wanted me to take it to a repair center which the closest repair facility is 30 miles away across the river in NJ. I live near NYC and there are no other options. Fender will not take their broken product back for an exchange. It appears they have a two for one warranty. If it breaks in two after you buy it you own both pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great AMP
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic amp. I’m sure this isn’t the most high end amp but it definitely gets the job done, and once you plug it into a computer, you can get just about any sound you want. It can get VERY loud and is easy to use and is actually pretty light. I would 100% recommend this AMP.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Adams

customer_reviews.title: A lotta power embedded in a not bulky, easy-carry amp
customer_reviews.text: With little effort I can even play "Jimi" thanx to the delay and other variations such as some "wah" one can put to work just by messing with the right buttons. Alas, I didn't try the Fuse app yet. Also amazing is the power of this amp: even maintaining the volume and gain knobs on 3 it is enuf to "shake the room"...LOL. 5 stars yessiree! Glad I didn't buy the Mustang I instead. The II has double of power for less than double of dough.
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Bedroom Amp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use at home to rehearse and it fits the bill perfectly. It is more than loud enough and if you put it in a corner, the bass response is great. The knobs are simple and clear and if you want to tweak, hook it up to the computer and you can go nuts. If you had to use it for a gig, that would work too. Just use the headphone jack or USB port and run it into the board.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Love it! 10/10
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I bought a Yamaha Pacifica a few months ago, and since then had been researching for an amp. The Fender Mustang I V2 always came up. This is great for personal practice or if you want to play in a small area. I really love this amplifier. I have not tried Fender FUSE yet, but am planning on it. Once again, I would recommend this amp to every beginner guitar player. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: SINA M JAMSHED

customer_reviews.title: ... was a Christmas present for my husband and he loved it! It sounds amazing and was a cheap
customer_reviews.text: It was a Christmas present for my husband and he loved it! It sounds amazing and was a cheap, but great deal. The sound quality is way beyond what you would expect from an amp at this price. It comes with software that you can use to alter the sound as well as a place to plug your MP3 player to play along with songs from your playlists. As a person who did not know anything about amps this was a great value at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfaction

customer_reviews.title: I plug my iphone in with backing tracks and play all styles using headphones and get more practice in at any hour of the day wit
customer_reviews.text: So much in a small package... lots of Amp simulations and effects. I plug my iphone in with backing tracks and play all styles using headphones and get more practice in at any hour of the day with a great sound. The cleans are awesome for trad jazz and my acoustics and the classic rock tones are all there with my Fender Tele and Ibanez guitars. I just love having it and other amps have been off since this one arrived. Small enough to take around for open mics without as much worry if something happens to it compared to a larger classic tube amp.
customer_reviews.author: Dave McDorman

customer_reviews.title: Killer Amp!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome amp! A killer beginner amp, and enough for the pro. Multiple style options is an understatement! Someone had asked if you could plug drums into it? It has a USB. Two pics included.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S. Ryburn

customer_reviews.title: Among the Best Budget Modeling Amps---Meh
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me and really want to dial in a sound, you'll spend much more time fiddling with the amp than you will playing. It's got all kinds of flexibility, but the end result is never quite there IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Software for this amplifier, Fuse, is no longer supported by Fender as of March 2020
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great until we tried to update the software and found out from Fender that they no longer support the software.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Logelin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool amp for the price
customer_reviews.text: The thing I like the most about this amp are the presets and the fact you can add more thru the Fuse Software. The thing I dislike is the fact that fender doesn't seem to be supporting this app any more.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah Fulton

customer_reviews.title: Quality Quality Quality
customer_reviews.text: I can't think of anything negative to say. You can make a plethora of sounds, save them, and the quality is top notch. Impressive output for its size. I've treated it pretty ruggedly and it shows no signs of not being able to keep up.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainCraboo

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding amp. The effects are great too
customer_reviews.text: Very nice amp. Great sound. Easy to carry. The onboard effects and reverb are surprisingly good. The different amp sounds are great too. This amp actually exceeded my expectations and I already have a 100watt Fender combo
customer_reviews.author: Joe21

customer_reviews.title: cannot use due to software
customer_reviews.text: I dont even know why they are still selling these. Fender no longer supports software updates and you can't update the firmware either. It cannot be used with your computer at all. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Khewitt

customer_reviews.title: Great Price ! Gread Product !
customer_reviews.text: Totally blown away with the Fender amp. Loud enough to play in my music room and loud enough for a small venue. Couldn't believe all the options of sound available. Great 1st amp or even a backup amp. Very very pleased with purchase and price !
customer_reviews.author: Grayhawk51

customer_reviews.title: Great for practice and experimenting
customer_reviews.text: It took some getting used to because there are so many settings. I've had it for a while now and only use 3 or 4 settings. The sound quality is good in a room where you don't have to crank it too high - say more than 7 or 8.
customer_reviews.author: Yukon John

customer_reviews.title: I liked my first Fender Mustang so much that I had ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked my first Fender Mustang so much that I had to get one for my granddaughter. I had two other amps that didn't even compare with the Fender Mustang, sold them both, they were the same size, but the sound was terrible and no matter how far you stood away from them, feedback was horrible. For the price, you can't go too wrong!
customer_reviews.author: The Watcher

customer_reviews.title: THE MOST FUN AMP EVER, and I've had dozens !
customer_reviews.text: great for practice, I put an Eminence Legend 10" spkr and baffle board in and use it for small club work. You can tweek the 24 presets to your hearts desire and get about every amp out there. Vintage Fender , Vox, Marshall , it's all there to find. The most fun amp ever.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick E.

customer_reviews.title: Ended up returning it because I loved it so much I got the 100 watt model ...
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning it because I loved it so much I got the 100 watt model with the 12" speaker. The larger model will have more sounds, more power obviously and a fuller more true to fidelity sound due to its 12" speaker
customer_reviews.author: P. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great Amp, Great Effects
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this amp to play my Ovation Balladeer on. The effects are a nice touch, like having effects pedals inside the amp! Also includes a USB Cable which you can connect to your computer and upload your music to your favorite music software.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Hunter

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for home use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my first amp to go with my Fender acoustic electric guitar. It's perfect for home use, and the wide array of presets allows for some really interesting sounds. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Recondo82

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great Fender sound, look, and heritage. Now I have a genuine Fender amp just like the great rock stars of the past several decades. I love it. I love the sparkly fabric on the grill. Great price. I don't need anything more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkly Raven

customer_reviews.title: Simply great!
customer_reviews.text: If you want an amp that has a ton of built in tones and effects in an easy simple package, this is it!! And of course that Fender sound.! I’d highly recommend the pedal switch for easy use between preset tones.
customer_reviews.author: Moogs

customer_reviews.title: Amazing at home practice amp
customer_reviews.text: THIS THING IS A BEAST. I live in a 1100 sq ft apt and it rocks the windows. I took it to my buddies pool hall and it carried within reason. Small space amazing sound. And you can do a lot with your laptop to make adjustments. Great buy, great price. And it came well before I expected it. All around wonderful experience on amazons part and fenders part for making a quality product (which is what they are known for).
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great practice or small venue amp
customer_reviews.text: Great for clean or distorted sound. Reverb sounds good, but I'm not impressed with the digital and analog delay presets. It is also window-rattling loud. There are a lot of useful presets, but you can also save your preferred settings and switch on the fly (I also purchased the Fender single foot switch). I haven't experimented with the software or the PC connection yet, but I have been able to achieve the sounds I've desired using the built in settings.
customer_reviews.author: Willie TEXAS

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I researched this heavily, and the vast majority of articles recommend this amp as the top practice amp for the money. Amazon is also offering the older, V1, but reviews appear to indicate that this is the better choice.I live in a house, but even so, I am pretty sure it could get loud enough to annoy my neighbors. I have been playing guitar for almost 50 years and gone through a few practice amps, this is the best one I have owned so far. haven't spent a lot of time with it yet to take advantage of all of its features, but I am enjoying it!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: surpassed my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned this amp would not meet my needs and expectations but it has surpassed it. The presets are good but with the fuse software its awesome. I can recommend this to anyone who wants great sound and versatility on a budget
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars noise level? I don't know if rating right. It is shhhh silent until you want it to scream or.... I have not tried the web site or connected it to the computer yet. I don't think I have to get the ac/dc sound or priest presets ect from there you just need to play around with settings. It has what 28 times 3 settings with tones. I will use mostly the distortion settings (4-5 X 3) the rest don't interest me unless I play some classical old school songs. It sounds great!!
customer_reviews.author: kep

customer_reviews.title: Fender Quality, Fender Sound.
customer_reviews.text: Mine Survived a house fire. Melted knobs, handle, burned and charred face, but still works to this day hahahaha, not to mention it is a very nicely featured and great sounding guitar amp. Love the USB recording feature, a must these days.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A. Foster

customer_reviews.title: And some very good presets! I have not changed anything since finding ...
customer_reviews.text: Only 25 pounds! What more is there to say? Oh...And some very good presets! I have not changed anything since finding a good sounding one when I first rehearsed with it! A very good value and I would recommend it to anybody tired of hauling around 150 and 200-watt, 50 and 100 pound monsters!
customer_reviews.author: curtis thomas

customer_reviews.title: Mustang 2 40w is fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: What a fun fun fun amp! 40 watts from a 12in speaker. Loud. Lots of great sounds to model. Haven't made it to Fuse site yet because I found so many wailing tones. I have my Crybaby wah running into it and it sounds awesome. Gee it's so great. I got the 40w instead of the 20w because many reviewers said it sounded less like a practice amp with better sound quality. I recommend spending a few extra bucks for the bigger sound. My 66 Super Reverb is great but just toooo loud to play at home. The Mustang 2 is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: CD3

customer_reviews.title: keep looking
customer_reviews.text: the big plus is a range of models, but none of them are great and some of them are really bad (esp the higher gain/overdriven models). And maybe I am just dumb, but I found the controls insanely complicated. The way the knobs all reset when you change models drives me crazy.
customer_reviews.author: bw

customer_reviews.title: Present for Husband
customer_reviews.text: He loved it. Uses it with his acoustic electric guitar. Can use his headphones with this. All I hear is the acoustic sound when he plays, while he hears the electric with headphones.
customer_reviews.author: STARZ

customer_reviews.title: Great amp for finding your sound
customer_reviews.text: By far the best amp for the money. There are tons of on board options that let you tune in whatever sound your looking for but the true beauty of this amp comes when you hook it up to fender fuse on your computer. It can emulate tons of well known amps and all sound amazing. Perfect amp for starting electric guitarists, not sure how it stands with a band yet but in my home the master volume has never been above 4.5, this thing is loud and the auxiliary input along with headphone port allows for an awesome practice sessions.
customer_reviews.author: cdwbom

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift for Christmas to someone who enjoys writing music and experimenting with sound. The recipient is in love. They are very impressed with the sound and the included effects. The ability to customize with the PC is awesome. They love their new "toy".
customer_reviews.author: Sarmarther

customer_reviews.title: Just an interface with a generic speaker
customer_reviews.text: Fender really should be ashamed of this one. It’s just an Irig with a mediocre speaker attached
customer_reviews.author: Brittany B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice little 1st amp. Lots of neat features you'd find on more expensive models.
customer_reviews.author: Coultergeist

customer_reviews.title: This is simply a great practice amp for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is simply a great practice amp for the price. It delivers great tones without having to plug in a bunch of effects and deal with the cable mess that comes with them, and the secondary jack makes it easy to plug in your phone or audio device to play along with practice tracks or any other songs you want to learn. The cabinet is heavy, solid and well built, which helps give this amp just a little bit of muscle. Not enough for gigging, but plenty enough for the average living or family room.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Newman

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I love my new amp- I use it with a Jackson JS11 Dinky... sweet sound whether I want to go a rock riff or a softer sweet sounding melody. I really like the way you can use the presets to save your favorite sound positions. Me being new to electric guitar I was baffled at which amp to buy- did a little reading and am happy with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: silent knight

customer_reviews.title: Amazon P. Is thee best! -1-
customer_reviews.text: Great amp by Fender and thank to A. Prime for being quick polite and a refund within hour!!!! The Amp just had a couple problems. Thank you A. Prime
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a cool smaller practice amp only to find out later that the FUSE app to use various tones and voicing is no longer supported by Fender. Feeling a little deceived here. The 24 preset tones sound muddy at best. Amazon should remove this obsolete item.
customer_reviews.author: Carl E.

customer_reviews.title: AMP for the house or garage
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little practice AMP, has a lot of built in features like modeling "amps" ,delays, and various other effects. This one is great for a starter AMP or for someone who is on a budget and wants a good AMP for the house.
customer_reviews.author: Empiror22

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile lil amp!
customer_reviews.text: Right out the box a nice looking amp, awesome sound for a little package. Will be upgrading the speaker to an Eminence Patriot 820h just personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: he is happy. Sorry I can't be of more help
customer_reviews.text: Received the item on time, it is for my husband. I know nothing about music and I am not familiar with any musical equipment. My husband has a couple of amps, but they are too big to be moving around and out of his studio. This he ordered so that he can practice in any room in the house, he is happy. Sorry I can't be of more help, as I said though he says that the sound is good as well as the quality it's a "Fender" he says.?!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: He acted like it was Christmas morning
customer_reviews.text: bought this as an anniversary present for my husband when his ancient one finally broke. He acted like it was Christmas morning, and loves all the unique features, especially the tuner.
customer_reviews.author: hoosakitty

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: I don`t play electric as much these days but this was a fine amp for the price, the computer features were cool as well
customer_reviews.author: Kinderhook

customer_reviews.title: Holy smokes! Just Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little amp, it's just fantastic! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this amp to anyone. I'm very very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: love my amp but have a problem with the treble ...
customer_reviews.text: love my amp but have a problem with the treble knob. everytime a preset is changed, or when it's first turned on, the Treble sounds like it's on maximum, until i move it even the slightest bit. i hoped a firmware update would improve this but no joy. i get used to it but it can happen when performing sometimes and that's very awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good starter amp.
customer_reviews.text: Just learning the guitar (like the rest of the Covid 19 world) ! This seems to be a good amp. I can use with my Taylor Academy 12E acoustic guitar and my Epiphany 335. I do not know enough to say this is a great amp. , but I'm happy so far and the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Britton

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty adequate
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is. Kind of wish the focus was on better tone rather than effects, many of which you will not use. Can’t complain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bartko

customer_reviews.title: Was a Present
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a friend who plays Guitar, he loved it. He went on a guitar binge for a week and did nothing but mess with it. He said it actually got him back in to playing guitar. The software seems pretty sophisticated. Apparently it can mimic any amp ever made and you can download music packs and effects. I wish they made a cellphone app for it, then he wouldn't have to keep it by his computer all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best amp purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: If you have been looking for an amp. LOOK NO FURTHER. This amp has given me the best of all worlds (as a semi beginner to the electric) small, portable, plenty loud, lots of sound options, sounds incredible, even has a usb option. Oh and the great price is a huge bonus
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Morrill

customer_reviews.title: Great little practice amp for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised at how good most of the presets are on this little gem of a practice amp! And I was able to tweak the others quickly to suit my ear! With the quality of sound, and variety of amp models and effects, as well as audio input and headphone jacks, this little amp will definitely serve me well!!
customer_reviews.author: Oliverzackley

customer_reviews.title: Good for new players
customer_reviews.text: As a pretty new guitar player, I find this Amp amazing. The effects are far better than what I could get with any of my pedals. The sounds are deap, and can get really mean. It's loud, and works great. Added bonus is the amazing tuner on the top. If you are new, this Amp is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt H.

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poor execution.
customer_reviews.text: Loud humming noise when using (even just reverb) efx, clean otherwise. Unable to record direct, which is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim A. Caudill

customer_reviews.title: Stunned by coolness factor on so many levels
customer_reviews.text: out of the box- all good. every cool thing you read about it is all true. Love.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cruickshank

customer_reviews.title: Good For a newb
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes his amp and is discovering all the features every day
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: but you can have a lot of fun with this amp even if you don't know what ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This thing can crank out some sound. I bought the 12 inch amp instead of the 10 inch because the guitar I was planning to buy dropped to a lower sale price, so I spent the extra to go with the 12 inch. I'm still a beginner for learning to play guitar, but you can have a lot of fun with this amp even if you don't know what you're doing!
customer_reviews.author: D. G. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for two days; however, I am already impressed by this amp. It's loud enough, multiple options (presets) to choose from and I'm not even close to being done exploring. I've made my neighbor interested in it as well and two other friends. As long as this amp lasts.... I think this is an OUTSTANDING purchase for my "little" (not so little sound) hobby. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jayme S.

customer_reviews.title: Computing functionally does not increase user enjoyment  but at least the effects here sound good.
customer_reviews.text: Fender stretches the price point to eternity with this line of gorgeous classic sounding guitar amplifiers. The amp is sturdy and highly responsive to touch. A real value surprise dripping with convincing tone modeling. Frankly all modeling amps extended digital features can be fully annoying at times-computing functionally does not increase user enjoyment but at least the effects here sound good. What a fun way to practice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: GREAT AMP!
customer_reviews.text: Amazed by this little amp. Very good! Easy to operate and with the Fender Fuse program goes to new heights. Models VERY well and gets 'tube tone' amazingly. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: but having fun..
customer_reviews.text: Has more features than I can play with, still figuring them all out, but having fun ... A great amplifier ... Can also plug my phone in to it and play along with unlimited you tube tunes
customer_reviews.author: Patrick W.

customer_reviews.title: Good starter amp
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter amp for someone that doesn’t want to purchase pedals and heads right away. The champ 20 is going to sound a lot better but without the extra features.
customer_reviews.author: J.J.

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this. I used this in bands in the 60s.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to be loud.
customer_reviews.text: So got this amp expecting a pretty basic amp with a few extra's. You can go deeeep with this amp when you hook it up to a computer, it's awesome. It's loud as !@#$ too, rattle the windows on half. I'm not an expert but I knew enough to go with Fender and I can say I'm pleased. Also had an issue with shipping, but their customer service is excellent and it was resolved real quick.
customer_reviews.author: Oh look someone's Amazon account

customer_reviews.title: I always loved the sound of a 65 Twin Reverb
customer_reviews.text: 50 years plus playing on and off. I own a very old Gibson Les Paul Deluxe a '57 Strat clone amongst many other guitars. I have owned an old 60's Fender Bassman, Musicman 112RP (Tubes), Peavey AC30, Champion, and Vypyr 30. I always loved the sound of a 65 Twin Reverb. None of the amps have ever delivered the sound of the Twin until I spent a 120.00 on this amp. Bravo! Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: G. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Very good amp
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good amp. It was actually better than I expected it to be. It was easily loud enough for me to play in my school talent show, in a very big auditorium. You can use the setting on the amp and create your own custom presets which are very easy to access. I highly recommend this amp to anyone who is considering purchase of it.
customer_reviews.author: Strafe Stopper

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an SRV fan and was looking for a small amp with a big blues sound. I found it. Perfect amp for my strat.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Most Bang For The Buck
customer_reviews.text: I've been out an amp since my old Peavey one bit the dust last year. I got that one in 2000. I am blown away by how far amps have come. Built in (pretty sweet) effects settings, an aux out, USB connection (which I admittedly haven't tried) and huge sound. I mainly use it for home and recording purposes, for my Les Paul. I used my Peavey a lot in auditoriums and I can tell this one would work even better. If it lasts me 14 or more years like the Peavey did, I'll be happy. Lovin' being able to jam again.
customer_reviews.author: Will H

customer_reviews.title: Sounds amazing. No need for an effect pedal now
customer_reviews.text: Wow this thing is a beast. Especially once you have it set up with the Fuse software. That's really where the magic happens. If you're in the market for a mid sized personal amp, go no further!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

product_meta.title: Fender Mustang I V2 20-Watt 1x8-Inch Combo Electric Guitar Amplifier
product_meta.description: style:Amp| Size:20 WattThe standard for modern guitar versatility and muscle. Mustang amps are incredible Fender tone machines for today's guitarists, driven by remarkably authentic amp models, a wealth of built-in effects and easy USB connectivity. And like no other amps, Mustang models make it easy to record, edit, store and share your music. Ideal for guitarists new to digital recording, the versatile Mustang I deliver an exciting ride for such a compact and easily portable design, with great tone from 20 watts of power, an 8" speaker and an astounding array of features.
feature_bullets: Reverb, delay/echo, tremolo, phaser and other effects
USB connectivity for audio recording output

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,083 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
